reviewText: Interesting concept, very confusing interface. Not recomended for the faint of heart.\n\nEDIT: Once you get into the game it can be pretty fun though!
voteText: 27 of 37 people (73%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I started playing this game,and I got confused the moment the interface opened. The first thing I did was start the campaign. A good thing because it started learning this game. The problem is it takes a long time to explain what everything means. NUM: n to n, SUM: n to n, sum %2. Even after playing through it all, and eventually finding out what it means. A few moments later, oh yeah, what does this mean again. No tips if you hover above the text. Try to find the right puzzle to find the description again.

This doesn't mean I don't enjoy this game. I like the concept and the puzzles. Logical thinking and math. I say yes to that. You can get into the game. It's an easy concept but addictive. It's a gem but unpolished. And therefore I do not recommend it (yet)

The came should be polished, and a lot.
cons:
Timer doesn't stop when finished.
Descriptions and interface confusing. Need more tooltips.
Hints show immediately. It ruins the fun in a logic game.
When finished a puzzle in campaign, no continue in screen, but on top of the screen there is a button, which you always can use
No good tutorial.

Pro:
Nice concept.
Getting more challenging over time, because rules change

reviewText:
If you like Hexcells, you may like this as well ;)

This is a really nice game! I do think it is more about logic and seeing patterns than it is about math. The little math you need to do is adding up numbers up till a sum of 16 :) Every level took me no more than 3 minutes.

Tutorial and tips are very helpfull and eleborate. I only don't get what the pink dotted line means, wasn't explained or I looked past it.. Didn't matter for completing the levels though.

After I finished the campaign, I tried to generate some playing fields of 3x4 and bigger but it keeps telling me it is impossible with whatever option I try. So I don't think there is any replayability to this game unfortunately :(

In the end I do think this game is definitely worth the €0,99.

reviewText:
Product received for free

As Odd||Even stands right now, avoid it.

It is completely unresponsive and the only keys that work as of this writing (7 May 2016) are the Alt+F4 to close it.  That's a pity because I was really wanting to play this game - it looks fun.

Save yourself $5 and wait for a fix before you buy the game.
To the devs: once a fix is rolled out, I'll take this down and give you a proper review, okay?
